fields.name: Balance Bikes
fields.description:
This session is for young children to have fun scooting around in a safe environment! This is the first step of the learning to ride journey.

Balance bikes are fantastic for developing children’s balance and basic skills to help them learn to ride alone,  quicker than using traditional stabilisers. Over a few sessions, riders will be able to scoot and glide, while having fun through an obstacle course, under the limbo pole and over ramps.

Children will need to be supported by a parent or carer.

Children are encouraged to bring their own helmet to this session. We have a limited number of helmets available which are cleaned before and after each session. 

Stabilizers are not allowed / used during the session.

fields.name: Learn to Ride
fields.description:
When children can hold a straight line on a balance bike while lifting their legs off the ground, they are ready to progress to pedals. The coach will teach them the basics to get them riding, starting and stopping all by themselves.

Riders must be confident on a balance bike to take part in these sessions.

Children will need to be supported by a parent or carer.

Children are encouraged to bring their own helmet to this session. We have a limited number of helmets available which are cleaned before and after each  session. 

Stabilizers are not allowed / used during the session.

fields.name: Pedal Basics
fields.description:
This session focuses on day to day riding skills and covers riding a narrow track, moving around cones and also how to walk, stand and check your bike. Riders will learn how to look around their surroundings when riding and how to use their brakes correctly without losing control.

Children are encouraged to bring their own helmet to this session. We have a limited number of helmets available which are cleaned before and after each session. 

Stabilizers are not allowed / used during the session.

fields.name: Cycle Skills
fields.description:
This session will further develop children’s bike handling and group riding skills.

Riders will learn techniques such as cornering, correctly mounting and dismounting a bike, gear selection and how to ride slowly. They will also learn how to lead, follow and ride next to each other. 

Children are encouraged to bring their own helmet to this session. We have a limited number of helmets available which are cleaned before and after each  session. 

Stabilizers are not allowed / used during the session.
